author: heinz.gassner
title: Business Solutions
description: Cardano with its research-based high-quality approach has great potential in real-world Industry and Business applications (B2B/B2B2C/B2C).

f6_assessments.q0: While I have spent most of my professional career in the MedTech industry, I must say that even though the company's digitalization strategy involves taking advantage of the advantages of Blockchain, they still regard this technology as something for the long-term. Therefore, I believe that if Cardano wishes to achieve its mission, we must address this field of "real world business". Furthermore, based on the description of the setting of this challenge and in comparison to our fund 9 strategic goals, I believe the team could have made a more thorough effort in terms of alignment. Unfortunately, the inadequate description of why this challenge is important, as well as the lack of clear guidance on the types of proposals appropriate for this challenge, can create confusion and overlap with other challenges in Catalyst. The voters should know that, although I believe it is important to focus on real business needs, these can be included in other challenges like "Products & Integrations," etc. My score for this section is 4.
f6_assessments.q1: In Fund 7 we had the first time we had this challenge in Catalyst, and in Fund 8 it was the third most popular challenge with the most proposals, although we will still need to determine how the community is responding in terms of quality of proposals in QA and number of votes in the voting phase. Clearly, the community is in a position to respond effectively to this challenge, and I am confident that this level of response and interest can be maintained and even improved in the next fund, since due to the experience gained in this fund, new gaps have been identified that will be addressed by new proposers. As a result of the amount of support from the community, they are asking for a budget increase from $1,000,000 to $1,500,000. This seems reasonable to me. I have assigned a score of 5 for this section.
f6_assessments.q2: This proposal's success criteria will need to be reviewed for future funding, and I believe that for this challenge to be effective and deliver the expected value to the community, it needs to be able to articulate success metrics that can be measured and traced with relative ease. There is no doubt that the types of metrics for a particular solution can vary greatly based on the type of industry and the stage at which it is in, however, I believe that a minimum outline of model metrics should have been presented not only for future proposers, but also for the community to take into consideration when performing audits. Therefore, I have decided to give a rating of 4.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge setting is a draft and the mention "More details to follow" makes this clear.

The evaluation of this challenge setting is difficult, as the proposer seems to have been unable to edit the description in due time.

The challenge question is not defined, instead of the question a statement has been included, so this compromises the understanding of the purpose of the challenge. There is not enough content to assess whether this challenge is in line with Cardano's mission. There are some brief mentions of Industry and business but without context there is no way to tell if this makes sense.
f6_assessments.q1: The challenge setting is a draft, there is not enough description for it to be possible to understand if this challenge can be addressed. Apparently the proposer was not able to edit the proposal in time.
f6_assessments.q2: The challenge setting is a draft, the definition of success and metrics presented are still insufficient for a proper performance evaluation. I would recommend including more key metrics and clarity in the outputs to be monitored by the challenge team.
f6_assessments.reply:
Well, it would have been easy to take a glance into Fund 7 Challenge setting. Due to a misunderstanding, the text was not updated in time. 

BUT: Kill a VERY important Challenge Setting due to this formal mistake ? 

I suggest to remove this rating, since other CA were also more tolerant and understood the importance of providing continuity in this field.

f6_assessments.q0:
This challenge is about using Cardano-based blockchain solutions to  businesses.  It is a follow-up on the business solutions challenge from fund8 and though the present challenge is brief, the previous challenge. I evaluate alignment based on three metrics: fund9 strategic goals, challenge setting guiding questions and the underlying ethos of the protocol.

The key goal of onboarding contributors is satisfied as it naturally lends itself to companies interested in distributed ledger technology adoption. It is, however, not very much aligned with the open-sourcing insofar as the default in many existing businesses (that I believe this challenge is aimed at) would not be open sourcing their code. It may be a springboard for mass-adoption as existing businesses with their customers is likely the easiest way to gain large user-bases. This is tailored to that.
f6_assessments.q1: The current fund8 business solution challenge has 146 ideas competing for $1M. A quick skim reveals a large number of high-potential projects from established businesses and it is clear that the community has the necessary skills and capacity to address this challenge. These include for example, “Licensing Remixed Music On-Chain”, “Open by default stock market” and “Enterprise Operating System”. The increased funding amount to $1.5M seem appropriate given the many quality and high-budget proposals.
f6_assessments.q2:
Unfortunately, this challenge setting is not complete and still in a draft stage. This makes it difficult to assess overall. It would set a bad precedent if I were to extrapolate based on the challenge briefing of the equivalent challenge from fund8. Hence I will have to assess it purely on the merits of its own which means that the verifiability is very low as the only two metrics suggested are “Target industries performance” and “Target customer performance”. The current fund8 version of the same proposal contains the following metrics and so it might perhaps be possible to use these once more.
- # of Cardano dApps supporting business solutions
- # of existing companies proposing Cardano-based solutions
- # of partnerships / joint ventures created between companies
- $ additional funding from other sources for the funded proposals
- $ projected cost savings
- $ projected revenue increase
- % growth in mainnet / testnet activity due to business solutions
 It is difficult to say what to do in this situation meaning that I will rate this as a 3.

f6_assessments.q0:
Developing business solution to real life business is certainly critical for Cardano to achieve its mission and become more and more globally present. Companies are realizing the value of blockchain but are still strugggling to see where this technology can be applied in their existing businesses. It is important for the community to make this bridge and create, alongside with these companies, the solutions they need, and this challenge is a good opportunity to do so. I also see this challenge as aligned with F9 strategic goal of "Accelerate the growth and evolution of developer & app ecosystem", at least.

However, the proposal itself it seems to be incomplete since theres very limited information and the statement "More details to follow." in the end. 
It would be nice to see here some guiding directions for proposers and more details on the approach the challenge would follow. Other important thing to notice is that in F8, there's already a challenge that seems to have a very similar objective (Business Solutions (B2B & B2C). As it is mentioned that they want to strengh what was started in F7 and F8, I'll assume it's a continuation. It would good thoug, to bring some results or numbers, at least related to proposals/projects in F7. They could mention also if there'll be any difference from these other challenges or if approach/scope will keep the same.
f6_assessments.q1:
Community is really capable of proposing and developing project on business solution theme. Actually, there are already several proposals and even executed that do this and even a very similar challenge in F8, with more than a 100 proposals submitted.
It is not clear if the challenge team will remain the same as in F8 (assuming is a continuation). I'll assume it will and score it 5 but it could be clearer here.
f6_assessments.q2:
there are no true kpis provided. What is mentioned in key metrics to measure are not metrics, and, this happened probably because the proposal is incomplete.
If we assume the kpis will the same for the F8 challenge (Business Solutions (B2B & B2C)), they are solid and will certainly help to verify progress towards soving the challenge. However, as I'm having to assume it, I'll score it 4 only. It is also imporant to do a critical exercise to assess if where we are in these metrics, thkining in F7 and F8 results and check if more kpis are necessary.

f6_assessments.q0: While I agree with the objective in mind, the proposed challenge is way too vague to guide proposals properly. The challenge is more a general idea than an actual target and the key metrics are very vague. The proposed challenge finishes with "more details to follow", but it's past the deadline to make edits, therefore I don't feel like, in its current form, the challenge would be a good use of funds in fund9.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposed challenge is too vague to actually guide good proposals. A good challenge would provide good success metrics for proposals, clear targets and objectives, as well as a more detailed description. This proposal fails to do so.
f6_assessments.q2: The target metrics to measure are too vague and hard to audit. "Target industries performance" doesn't mean anything specific. This could be measured in dollars invested, number of new companies onboarded, leads generated, or many other things. Same for "target customer performance" - this is too broad of a metric to actually audit anything.

f6_assessments.q0: With the level where the Cardano ecosystem wants to explore the challenge bridges those gaps but is very scanted written up for proposers to understand what they need to do.
f6_assessments.q1: There is reference to Fund 6 and Fund 7 for the brief but there are no links to what the proposals were for easy of assessment, one need to guess or go search for whatever was done. There needs a little more information to help in assessment.
f6_assessments.q2: Though there is a budget and the conditionality of accessing the funds is not well spelled out. Looks like the development of the challenge was not completed and there is the need of more details

importance: Industry and business is slowly recognising the disruptive potential behind DLT/Blockchain, WEB 3.0 and Metaverse. We need to be ready.
success: Identifying target industries & companies, form attractive service-approaches by complementing IOHK/Emurgo, onboard key-clients.
